text: Josephine Oboh-Macleod Charity also known as JOM Charity is an organization founded by Josephine Oboh-Macleod to promote art and culture worldwide. == History == According to Vanguard Newspaper, JOM Charity is collaborating with Kakofoni and Johfrim Arts and Design Studio to launch the Afro-Celtic exhibition for promoting art and culture in Africa and Scotland. === Awards === Milngavie Old People’s Association described JOM Charity as the first Art and Well-being Charities founded by a black woman of African descent Josephine Oboh-MacLeod. === Collaborations === JOM Charity has worked with Women’s Integration Network, Kakofoni Foundation Nigeria, Milngavie Old People’s Association, Twechar Healthy Living Centre, and others. According to the founder, the organization has supported other NGO's including Coalition For Racial Equality and Rights (CRER). == References== ==Other websites== * Official website Category:Charities of the United Kingdom Category:Organisations based in Glasgow
title: Jom Charity
